title: Decisive: How to Make Better Choices in Life and Work
description: Decisive by Chip Heath and Dan Heath explores why humans often make poor decisions and offers a research-backed framework to improve decision-making. The book introduces the WRAP process—Widen Your Options, Reality-Test Your Assumptions, Attain Distance Before Deciding, and Prepare to Be Wrong. Through engaging stories and practical tools, the Heath brothers help readers recognize and overcome common decision-making biases. The book empowers individuals and organizations to make smarter, more confident choices in both personal and professional contexts.

modules.title: Introduction & The Four Villains of Decision Making
modules.goal: Understand the common pitfalls that undermine good decisions and set the stage for the WRAP framework.
key_points: Identifies four villains: narrow framing, confirmation bias, short-term emotion, and overconfidence.
Explains why traditional decision-making is often flawed.
Introduces the need for a systematic process to counteract these villains.

modules.title: Widen Your Options
modules.goal: Learn techniques to break out of narrow framing and generate better alternatives.
key_points: People tend to limit choices and miss alternatives due to narrow framing.
Encourages using 'And' instead of 'Or' to expand choices.
Suggests considering opportunity cost and seeking outside perspectives.

modules.title: Reality-Test Your Assumptions
modules.goal: Develop strategies to question assumptions and gather unbiased information.
key_points: Describes confirmation bias and how it distorts information gathering.
Advocates for testing hypotheses with small experiments.
Recommends seeking disconfirming evidence and asking tough questions.

modules.title: Attain Distance Before Deciding
modules.goal: Learn how to gain perspective and prevent short-term emotions from dominating decisions.
key_points: Short-term emotions can cloud judgment and lead to impulsive decisions.
Promotes the '10/10/10 Rule' to consider long-term impacts.
Suggests using an outsider's perspective for objectivity.

modules.title: Prepare to Be Wrong
modules.goal: Understand how to anticipate obstacles and create plans for dealing with uncertainty and mistakes.
key_points: People are often overconfident in their predictions and plans.
Encourages setting tripwires and pre-committing to actions.
Promotes the use of premortems to envision and address possible failures.

modules.title: Wrapping Up: Applying WRAP
modules.goal: Consolidate the WRAP process and learn how to apply it in real-world situations.
key_points: Summarizes each step of the WRAP process and their interplay.
Offers practical tools and checklists for everyday decisions.
Highlights case studies and examples of successful implementation.
